page.title: 11WALDRINGFIELD PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The only {school} in the area is situated at Waldringfield, a small village on the South bank of the Deben between Woodbridge and Felixstowe Ferry. The school was founded in 1874 by the Reverend Thomas Waller, rector of Waldringfield, and has had close ties with the Waller family. The school field was given in later years by another member of the family. Two further classrooms and a hall have been added to the original building. In 1985 there are 40 pupils in two classes, Infant and Junior taken by the Head Teacher and the assistant. This is a sharp contrast to ten years ago when the number was 80. The catch- ment area consists of Waldringfield, and the surrounding villages of Newbourne, Henley and Brightwell. Most children continue their education at Kesgrave High School. Dianne Ninmey.
